intro: Draba koiteseki, commonly known as the Koiteseki whitlow grass, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
